definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
lit. the clumsy bird flies early (idiom); fig. to work hard to compensate for one's limited abilities
lit. clumsy mouth and broken tongue (idiom); awkward speaker

sentences.english: You are a bit  scatty so you don't check names on payslips before opening them.
sentences.chinese: 你有点笨，所以才没核实工资单上的名字就打开看。

sentences.english: He was so stupid as to forged his own name.
sentences.chinese: 他笨到连自己的名字也记不起来。

sentences.english: I am as awkward as a cow on skates.
sentences.chinese: 我笨得像一头穿着溜冰鞋的牛。

sentences.english: At school teachers couldn’t decide if I was really stupid or really intelligent.
sentences.chinese: 在大学之前老师不能认定我真的很笨或者很聪明。

sentences.english: Who says guys are just unfeeling louts who care only about themselves?
sentences.chinese: 谁说那些只在乎他们自己的人是不会觉得自己很笨的？

sentences.english: In fact pigs are not silly at all.
I'm sorry, did you just call me a stupid-head ?
sentences.chinese: 等一下，你刚叫我笨脑袋瓜子？

sentences.english: Medusa's terrible head when i have a glance with it.
sentences.chinese: 第一眼看到这集线器就觉得像梅杜莎的笨脑袋。

sentences.english: Bad workmen often blame their tools;
sentences.chinese: 工匠自己笨，常常怪刀钝。

sentences.english: The reason being, again, computers are not very bright.
sentences.chinese: 你们也知道的，电脑很笨的。

sentences.english: She is rather stupid; but fairly good- looking.
sentences.chinese: 她相当笨，但长得十分漂亮。

sentences.english: Kind of a stupid program, why?
sentences.chinese: 是个比较笨的程序，为什么？

sentences.english: He is clumsy with his hands.
Arnold is a blockhead if I ever saw one.
sentences.chinese: 阿诺德是我见过的非常笨的人。

sentences.english: I sincerely hope that you can use your specific love me this stupid woman.
sentences.chinese: 我真心希望，你能用你的专一去爱我这个笨女人。

sentences.english: Your mum's so stupid she tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 你妈妈这么笨，她的脚肯定被无绳电话绊倒过。

definition: stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion
unable to understand/can't get the point
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
